title: Tracking the Technology Sector - AT&T, Cisco Systems, Micron Technology, Oracle and Hewlett-Packard
text: Tracking the Technology Sector - AT&T, Cisco Systems, Micron Technology, Oracle and Hewlett-Packard  46:50 Tracking the Technology Sector - AT&T, Cisco Systems, Micron Technology, Oracle and... -- NEW YORK, September   <-   NEW YORK , September   ACI Association has initiated research coverage on the following equities: AT&T Inc. (NYSE: T ), Cisco Systems, Inc. (NASDAQ: CSCO ), Micron Technology, Inc. (NASDAQ: MU ), Oracle Corporation (NASDAQ: ORCL ), Hewlett-Packard Company (NYSE: HPQ ). On Friday, September 18, 2015 , Nasdaq ended at 4,827.23, down 1.36%, DOW declined 1.74% to finish the day at 16,384.58 and the S&P closed at 1,958.03, down 1.62%. Register for your complimentary reports at the links given below. -- AT&T Inc . -- AT&T Inc.'s stock edged lower by 0.70% to close Friday's session at USD 32.55 . The stock recorded a trading volume of 44.63 million shares, which was above its 50-day daily average volume of 33.06 million shares and above its 52-week average volume of 28.24 million shares. Over the last three days, AT&T Inc.'s shares have declined by 0.94% and in the past one week the stock has moved down 0.52%. Over the last three months the stock has lost 6.97% and in the past six months the shares have shed 2.05%. Further, AT&T Inc. has a current dividend yield of 5.78%. The company is trading at a price to earnings ratio of 32.55 and at a price to book ratio of 1.95. This compares to a historical PE ratio of 28.12. The historical PB ratio is near to 2.02. Additionally, the stock is trading at a price to cash flow ratio of 5.37. Sign up and read the free notes on T at: http://www.aciassociation.com/T.pdf -- Cisco Systems Inc . -- The stock of Cisco Systems Inc. lost 1.31% to close Friday's session at USD 25.54 . The shares of the company moved in the range of USD 25.25 and USD 25.74 and a trading volume of 40.02 million shares was recorded, which was greater than its 150-day daily average volume of 26.09 million shares. Over the last five days Cisco Systems Inc.'s shares have declined by 1.84% and in the past one month the stock has lost 9.59%. Moreover, over the last three months the stock has declined 12.02% and in the past six months the shares have registered a loss of 10.20%. Further, the company is trading at a price to earnings ratio of 14.76 and at a price to book ratio of 2.18. This compares to a historical PE and PB ratio of 16.27 and 2.42, respectively. Besides, the stock is trading at a price to cash flow ratio of 10.27 and at a price to sales ratio of 2.63. Register for free on ACI Association and access the latest research on CSCO at: http://www.aciassociation.com/CSCO.pdf -- Micron Technology Inc . -- Micron Technology Inc.'s stock declined 5.55% to end Friday's session at USD 15.50 . The company's shares fluctuated in the range of USD 15.36 and USD 16.19 . A total of 36.70 million shares exchanged hands, which surpassed its 52-week average volume of 26.83 million shares. Over the last three days Micron Technology Inc.'s shares have declined by 6.17% and in the past one week the stock has moved down 7.74%. Further, the company is trading at a price to earnings ratio of 5.17, compared to the historical PE ratio of 12.91. The price to book ratio stood at 1.43. The historical PB ratio is near to 3.27. Additionally, the stock is trading at a price to cash flow ratio of 3.23 and at a price to sales ratio of 1.06. The complete research on MU is available for free at: http://www.aciassociation.com/MU.pdf -- Oracle Corp oration -- Oracle Corp's stock lost 0.98% to finish the session at USD 36.38 . The stock recorded a trading volume of 34.92 million shares, which was above its 50-day daily average volume of 15.33 million shares. Over the last five days Oracle Corp's shares have declined by 4.06% and in the past one month the stock has lost 8.66%. In addition, over the last three months the stock has lost 12.53% and year to date the shares have shed 18.17%. Oracle Corp has a current dividend yield of 1.65% and is trading at a price to earnings ratio of 17.00. The price to book ratio was 3.25. This compares to a historical PE and PB ratio of 19.71 and 3.88, respectively. Additionally, the stock is trading at a price to cash flow ratio of 11.50 and at a price to sales ratio of 4.13. Free in-depth research on ORCL is available at: http://www.aciassociation.com/ORCL.pdf -- Hewlett-Packard C ompany -- Hewlett-Packard Co's stock declined 3.74% to close at USD 26.54 . The stock recorded a trading volume of 29.48 million shares, which surpassed its 52-week average volume of 12.72 million shares. Over the last three days Hewlett-Packard Co's shares have declined by 2.10% and in the past one week the stock has moved down 2.25%. Moreover, in the last six months the stock has lost 20.25% and year to date the shares have shed 32.59%. Further, Hewlett-Packard Co has a current dividend yield of 2.65%. The company is trading at a price to earnings ratio of 10.83, compared to the historical PE ratio of 13.68. Additionally, the stock is trading at a price to sales ratio of 0.45. The complimentary notes on HPQ can be downloaded in PDF format at: http://www.aciassociation.com/HPQ.pdf -- About ACI Association: Active Charter Investors Association ("ACI Association") produces regular sponsored and non-sponsored reports, articles, stock market blogs, and popular investment newsletters covering equities listed on NYSE and NASDAQ and micro-cap stocks.
